Description: Postcard; printed paper; shows an Egyptian peasant with a pair of yoked bullocks in a field close to Cairo.
Curator's comments: Old card; excellent condition; postally unused but addressed and with a message, implying that it was sent back in a mail bag, probably as part of the British Armed Forces. The message is dated 6th April 1919 and reads: "This looks to me to be at Giza, close to where I was. This is how they plough out here. Daddy".
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Antiques On High Ltd
